item.title: Brené Brown Doesn’t Want to Be Your Self-Help Guru Anymore
item.description: The author and podcaster wants to apply her old ideas about vulnerability and empathy to the workplace.

item.title: I’ve Prepped for Future Disasters. Do I Have to Help Those Who Didn’t?
item.description: We can’t be the emergency food bank for everyone, but could we really let others suffer?

item.title: How JPMorgan Enabled the Crimes of Jeffrey Epstein
item.description: A Times investigation found that America’s leading bank spent years supporting — and profiting from — the notorious sex offender, ignoring red flags, suspicious activity and concerned executives.

item.title: What We Know About JPMorgan’s Long Relationship With Jeffrey Epstein
item.description: Times reporters combed through thousands of pages of legal and financial records to understand how America’s leading lender enabled the notorious sexual predator.

item.title: The Best Part of Any Piece of Mail Is the Stamp
item.description: These tiny rectangles hold memory and mystery, and they will travel where you will not.

item.title: A Jane Austen-Inspired Roast Chicken That’s Remarkably Well Done
item.description: A pairing of grapes and red onions makes a classic recipe feel especially current.

item.title: Guitar Nerds and Surf Bros Didn’t Want to ‘Get Political.’ Then Came the Tariffs.
item.description: In the online niches where people discuss guitars, surfing, makeup and countless other interests, ideology is becoming harder to quarantine.

item.title: An Essay Contest Winner Used A.I. Should She Return the $1,000 Award?
item.description: What happened should be taken as a wake-up call, rather than a crime scene.

item.title: Is It Cutesy or Abominable to Make Up Random Words?
item.description: A ruling on a dispute over shortening “groceries” to “grosh.”

item.title: How the Trump Administration Is Dismantling America’s Cancer-Research System
item.description: Here are the takeaways from The New York Times Times Magazine article on how the cancer-research system, which has helped save millions of lives, is under threat in one of its most productive moments.

item.title: Trump Is Shutting Down the War On Cancer
item.description: America’s cancer research system, which has helped save millions of lives, is under threat in one of its most productive moments.

item.title: Late-Night TV Is Fading. There’s One Part You May Come to Miss.
item.description: Most of what late-night talk shows offer has been supplanted by the internet — except for the role of the wry, dispassionate host.

item.title: It Isn’t Just the U.S. The Whole World Has Soured on Climate Politics.
item.description: How do we think about the climate future, now that the era marked by the Paris Agreement has so utterly disappeared?
